skill.name: nextjs-devtools
skill.description:
Next.js development tooling via MCP. Inspect routes, components, build info, and debug Next.js apps.
Use when working on Next.js applications, debugging routing, or inspecting app structure.
NOT for general React or non-Next.js projects.

security_audit.summary: This skill provides Next.js development tooling through an MCP client that connects to the next-devtools-mcp server. It includes a generic MCP client script capable of executing user-provided commands via subprocess and shell, which is necessary for MCP functionality but introduces execution risk. All capabilities align with the stated purpose of Next.js development tooling.

medium_findings.title: Subprocess shell execution with user-provided commands
medium_findings.description:
The StdioTransport class in mcp-client.py uses subprocess.Popen with shell=True to execute commands (line 204-212). The command is passed via the --stdio/-s CLI argument. While this is necessary for MCP stdio transport functionality, shell=True can enable command injection if input is not properly validated. An attacker who controls the command argument could execute arbitrary shell commands.

Relevant code:
```python
self._process = subprocess.Popen(
    self.command,
    shell=True,
    stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
    stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
    stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
    text=True,
    bufsize=1
)
```

low_findings.title: Downloads and executes npm package at runtime
low_findings.description: The start-server.sh script executes `npx next-devtools-mcp@latest` which downloads and runs an external npm package. While this is expected behavior for MCP tooling, it involves dynamic code execution from npm registry without integrity verification. Users should only install trusted packages.

content.user_title: Debug Next.js applications with MCP tools
content.value_statement: Debugging complex Next.js applications requires inspecting routes, components, and build configurations. This skill provides MCP-based tools to list routes, examine components, and check build info directly from your development environment.
actual_capabilities: List all app routes in a Next.js application
Get detailed information about specific routes
List React components used in the application
limitations: Only works with Next.js projects, not plain React apps
Requires npx to be installed for MCP server startup
Build info may be empty if next build has not been run
No direct code editing or modification capabilities

use_cases.title: Inspect application structure
use_cases.description: List all routes and components in a Next.js project to understand the app architecture quickly.

use_cases.title: Debug build configurations
use_cases.description: Check build settings and next.config.js to troubleshoot deployment or build failures.

use_cases.title: Navigate unfamiliar codebases
use_cases.description: Explore route hierarchy and component organization to understand new Next.js projects efficiently.

prompt_templates.title: List all routes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use nextjs-devtools to list all routes in this Next.js application.

prompt_templates.title: Get route details
prompt_templates.prompt: Get detailed information about the /api/users route including its handler type and parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Check build config
prompt_templates.prompt: Use get-build-info to show the current build configuration for this Next.js project.

prompt_templates.title: Find components
prompt_templates.prompt: List all React components in this application to understand the UI structure.

output_examples.input: List all routes in this Next.js application

best_practices: Run next build before using get-build-info to ensure build data is available
Execute from the Next.js project root directory for accurate results
Use list-routes first to understand the application structure before drilling into details
anti_patterns: Using nextjs-devtools on non-Next.js React projects
Expecting real-time updates without refreshing build data
Running the skill outside of a Next.js project directory

faq.question: Does this work with Next.js 13+ App Router?
faq.answer: Yes, it supports both App Router and Pages Router configurations.

faq.question: What Next.js versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Next.js 12, 13, 14, and 15 when using the latest next-devtools-mcp.

faq.question: Can I use this with a local MCP server?
faq.answer: Yes, use mcp-client.py with --url flag to connect to any running MCP server.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill only reads project files for inspection. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is no routes found?
faq.answer: Ensure you are running from the Next.js project root and the .next directory exists.

faq.question: How is this different from using npx directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides integrated access through MCP for AI assistants with structured output.
